May 2021 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

We are happy to release another edition of the Justia Insider. In the lead-up to Mother's Day in Mexico and the US, Justia pays tribute to all wonderful moms in the world. Do not miss the chance to show your love and gratitude. We are also happy to see everybody is focused, and team members have contributed to establishing and achieving the company goals during this first quarter of 2021. Thank you all!

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Contributing to Google Tag Manager Templates Gallery: We started contributing with templates to the Google Tag Manager community gallery. Go to this page and type in "Justia" in the search box.

Justia Lawyer Directory Data Update: We completed the first round of significant updates to our Lawyer Directory by updating the information on more than 600K profiles. This will make it easier for lawyers to claim their JLD profiles.

Content for Justia Lawyer Directory (Top Practice Area Pages): All of the top-level practice area pages have dedicated content now.

Visual Regression QA: Keeping up with our quality assurance efforts, we implemented a visual regression testing tool to monitor any visual changes to our Justia properties. The new implementation will help us reduce the time spent monitoring whenever there's a change to our traditional Justia look and feel.

2020 State Codes: We started our yearly State Codes by pushing the first updated state of the year live: 2020 Arizona Revised Statutes. Also, new team members who joined the Engineering Team within the last month are helping this time.

Google My Business (Malicious Updates Detection): We are committed to guarding the integrity of the information in our clients' GMB listings by keeping track of any edits to their location name and bringing it back to their correct value. This is a new feature in the SEO Tool.

Infrastructure and Server Maintenance: As usual, we keep performing maintenance to our server infrastructure regularly. We continue with updates to our databases by covering the Ask a Lawyer DB and others supporting our clients' and Justia friends' properties. We also performed an upgrade to our HelpDesk system.

Engineering Team

UPCOMING HOLIDAYS

Dates to Remember

Labor Day (Mexico) - May 1st*

Labor Day, also known as International Workers Day, is a federal public holiday in Mexico. It is held on May 1st each year to celebrate workers and the labor movement's fight for workers' rights and conditions. Labor Day was first formally celebrated in Mexico back in 1923.
Mother’s Day (Mexico) - May 10th

As opposed to Mother’s Day in the U.S., Mother’s Day in Mexico is always celebrated on May 10th. During this celebration, people honor their mothers and thank them for their efforts in bringing them up. For children, it is one of the most respected and expected holidays.
Memorial Day - May 31st*

Memorial Day, originally known as Decoration Day, is a United States federal holiday commemorating those who have fallen in military service to their country. It is celebrated yearly on the last Monday of May. It is an occasion to honor those lost in combat and decorate their graves.

*This is a federal holiday observed by Justia. For more information, please visit Justikia.

Did You Know?

Jesus Sanchez Participated in a University Event

Jesus was invited to participate with a Labor Engineering Workshop at a local university (Universidad Tecnológica de Torreón, UTT). The workshop's goal was to share his working experience as a client support specialist to provide the attendees with an opportunity to approach the professional field. During the workshop, he spoke about Justia as a company, what we do, its presence in México, a bit about the company culture, and his personal experience within the company. He ended up his participation with a reflection on the extended stay in an organization.

Did You Know?

Stacy’s New Role at Harvard Innovation Labs

Stacy now serves as an Expert-in-Residence at Harvard Innovation Labs. The Experts-in-Residence (EiR) Program brings together active entrepreneurs and business leaders to advise Harvard students and help nurture their ideas. Congratulations, Stacy, on your new career endeavor!

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Think Like an Artist by Will Gompertz

Available on Amazon

A book that teaches us how to create or improve our productivity in our daily tasks. I highly recommend reading this book as Will Gompertz uses real examples from well-known artists. The case scenarios can be related to some situations that we are currently living in our daily lives. We can learn how creativity is involved in everything we do and lead us to a better way to think before creating something or doing a task. Adding art or creativity to everything you do will make a very positive impact in your life.

- Alejandra Medina

Collaborators: Miguel Berlanga, Donovan Coronado, Haydee Garcia, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta, and Jose Ramos
